title: How to Care for 10 or More Stuffed Animals

steps.headline: Every day before you go to school, feed them breakfast and get them ready for the day.
steps.description:
Get them dressed and brush their teeth after they eat breakfast, if you want! Take out toys and games and tell them the responsibilities they have and chores they need to do for example:
Oldest stuffed animal does laundry and cooks. Middle stuffed animals do the dishes and fold clothes. Youngest stuffed animals vacuum. Remember give all the stuffed animals a responsibility no matter what!

steps.headline: After school, give them a snack and inspect the chores they did!
steps.description: If chores are not done, then scold them and give them a not too harsh punishment but they still learn their lesson! At dinner time, feed them a healthy meal and remind them to eat their veggies or no dessert.

steps.headline: Give all your stuffed animals a chance to watch their show on tv!
steps.description: For example, the youngest stuffed animals watch their show first, the middle stuffed animals and then the oldest stuffed animals.

steps.headline: No matter what happens...Never compare or have favorites...All your teddies, stuffed animals, plush toys, and cuddly toys deserve love!
Ask each of your stuffed animals if they want to come with you on the trip!
steps.description: If 1 or 2 want to come bring them! Plus learn to care less when people stare whisper...if they have a problem that's their problem, your stuffed animals who cares!

steps.headline: If your stuffed animal gets sick, give it rest and give it the cure to the sickness to care for your sick stuffed animal.
Make a name tag for each of your stuffed animals if it gets lost...It'll raise your chance's of getting it back.
At the end of the day you are all exhausted, so put them all in bed.
steps.description: If you have a trundle bed pull out your trundle halfway if your parents let you! Then tuck them all in.

steps.headline: Take some time and go to the library and get a chapter book to read to them every night before bed.
steps.description: Then repeat when you get to the end of the book. If any of your stuffed animals are still awake, sing them a lullaby.

text:
Basic Care and Needs Every day before you go to school, feed them breakfast and get them ready for the day. Get them dressed and brush their teeth after they eat breakfast, if you want! Take out toys and games and tell them the responsibilities they have and chores they need to do for example:
Oldest stuffed animal does laundry and cooks. Middle stuffed animals do the dishes and fold clothes. Youngest stuffed animals vacuum. Remember give all the stuffed animals a responsibility no matter what! After school, give them a snack and inspect the chores they did! If chores are not done, then scold them and give them a not too harsh punishment but they still learn their lesson! At dinner time, feed them a healthy meal and remind them to eat their veggies or no dessert. Give all your stuffed animals a chance to watch their show on tv! For example, the youngest stuffed animals watch their show first, the middle stuffed animals and then the oldest stuffed animals. No matter what happens...Never compare or have favorites...All your teddies, stuffed animals, plush toys, and cuddly toys deserve love!  Travel Ask each of your stuffed animals if they want to come with you on the trip! If 1 or 2 want to come bring them! Plus learn to care less when people stare whisper...if they have a problem that's their problem, your stuffed animals who cares! If your stuffed animal gets sick, give it rest and give it the cure to the sickness to care for your sick stuffed animal.  Make a name tag for each of your stuffed animals if it gets lost...It'll raise your chance's of getting it back.  Bedtime At the end of the day you are all exhausted, so put them all in bed. If you have a trundle bed pull out your trundle halfway if your parents let you! Then tuck them all in. Take some time and go to the library and get a chapter book to read to them every night before bed. Then repeat when you get to the end of the book. If any of your stuffed animals are still awake, sing them a lullaby. Good night.
